context: The word 'kõigil' is the adessive case plural form of 'kõik', meaning 'all'. In Estonian, the adessive case typically indicates location or instrumentality ('on/at/with'). So 'kõigil' means 'with all' or 'among all people/things'. It's used when something happens in relation to everyone or everything collectively. The word shows both plurality (multiple things/people) and spatial relationship.
